text.text_translated:
Many companies have noticed that the sharing economy (a system where people share unused resources to earn money) can be very profitable. Therefore, they try to gain from it.  

A business model (a plan that shows how a company makes money) has become very popular. One popular model uses an online platform to connect customers with people who can provide a product or service.  

Airbnb, for example, acts as a middleman and lets owners rent out their empty rooms or houses as accommodation that earns them good money.  

Another example is Uber. It encourages people to use their own cars as taxis so they can earn extra cash in their free time.

feedback.feedback: This is an exemplary simplification that passes all checks with high scores. The output successfully maintains factual integrity and meaning. The handling of keywords is a model of good practice; the parenthetical definitions for 'sharing economy' (where people share resources like cars or homes for a fee) and 'business model' (how a company plans to make money) are clear, concise, and perfectly integrated. The vocabulary strategy is excellent, effectively simplifying complex terms like 'lucrative' to the descriptive phrase 'that earns them good money'. Furthermore, the text's structure is improved for B1 readability by splitting longer, more complex sentences into shorter, more direct ones. This is a high-quality submission with no required changes.

best_attempt.text_translated:

Airbnb, for example, acts as a middleman and lets owners rent out their empty rooms or houses as accommodation that earns them good money.
